title: What is the difference between reciting number and counting? - Quora

response.answer_text: So my 20mo has a real thing for numbers. He's been able to recognise the numbers 0–10 for a few months now, and he's able to recite the numbers in sequence and likes to wonder around saying them to himself. But I think he may started to count. If I ask him 'how many?'he points and say'waa,doo,tee…'he can currently do up to 5 objects and adds another number in sequence every couple of days. I'd this true counting? Every so often I ask him’how many’and he responds immediately with the number’one or two’rather than counting up’one, two, the’. This is what has made me wonder…. Does anyone have any experience with this?

Reciting no. is memorising numbers. Counting is the process of determining the number of elements . Reciting helps in counting. Since you remember all the no.s , you could use them in counting different elements in your day to day life.
